<<<<<<< HEAD
By the King. A proclamation to declare His Maiesties pleasure touching his royall coronation, and the solemnitie thereof. England and Wales. Sovereign (1625-1649 : Charles I) Charles I, King of England, 1600-1649.
2 sheets.
by Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, printers to the Kings most excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : M. DC. XXV. [1625, i.e. 1626]
Dated at end: White-Hall, the seuenteenth day of Ianuary, in the first yeere of our reigne .. The years are given according to Lady Day dating. Arms 12; Steele notation: and diuers 2) any Our. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
=======

2 sheets.
by Bonham Norton and Iohn Bill, printers to the Kings most excellent Maiestie, Imprinted at London : M. DC. XXV. [1625, i.e. 1626]
Dated at end: White-Hall, the seuenteenth day of Ianuary, in the first yeere of our reigne .. The years are given according to Lady Day dating. Arms 12; Steele notation: and diuers 2) any Our. Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
